title: Torrent sites are infiltrating Google Search with some crafty SEO hacks
description: Google Looker Studio is being abused to get sites promoting torrents high on search engine results pages.

title: Meta is finally trying to protect teens from 'suspicious adults' on Instagram and Facebook
description: In addition to the security update, Meta will be working with the NCMEC to stop the spread of teens' private content.

title: Windows 11 really wants you to get a VPN
description: Windows 11 goes all-out on VPN usage with new connection status icon in its upcoming build.

title: Google Drive malware is targeting governments around the world
description: Chinese hackers are storing malware on legitimate cloud services, hoping to bypass security protections.

title: LG's new 'invisible' speakers could revolutionize car audio
description: South Korean brand claims its new system uses small flat panels to project audio without compromising sound quality.

title: Wix gathers all its SEO tools onto one page
description: Wix aims to simply SEO offering by updating its tool to function on a single one page.

title: Microsoft Teams could about to solve one of your biggest business problems
description: Microsoft Teams is adding more scheduling features to solve this major headache.

title: Should I buy the Roborock S4 Max?
description: The Roborock S4 Max is a popular choice of robot vacuum cleaner - we find out why and if you should buy.

title: The best PS5 SSD just hit its lowest price ever for Black Friday
description: Amazon's PS5 SSD deals are currently offering the WD Black SN850 at a historic lowest-ever price for Black Friday.

title: This new malware is able to bypass all of Microsoft's security warnings
description: Crooks bypass Mark of the Web and deliver powerful trojans by exploiting Windows zero-day.

title: Bag 3 months free with IPVanish's killer Black Friday VPN deal
description: IPVanish is no stranger to Black Friday VPN deals, and this year it's dropped a doozy. At $3.19 a month including 3 months free, it's not to be missed.

title: Charlie Cox's Treason is the gritty James Bond-style show that Netflix needs
description: Daredevil star Charlie Cox makes his Netflix return in Treason, a new spy thriller series coming in December.

title: VMware adds Apple Silicon support for its desktop hypervisors
description: Macs using Apple Silicon will now be able to run and emulate foreign operating systems using VMware.

title: This ransomware will steal your Discord account and encrypt all your files for good measure
description: AXLocker is after the crypto community, who prefer to communicate on Discord.

description: A docuseries detailing The Rings of Power's development has been announced by Amazon – and it's available now.

title: Your CIO may now wield more power than ever before
description: CIOs are now second behind only CEOs in determining the future of their organizations, if research from Citrix is to be believed.

title: Microsoft’s embarrassing Windows 11 printer fail finally gets fixed – but is it too late?
description: Windows 11 is feeling a little too much like Windows 10 in terms of quality assurance at this point.

title: Mastodon will lose to Hive as the 'next Twitter' if it doesn't fix 3 big problems
description: I've gone from using Mastodon once a week to once every hour, but it's still not a great replacement... and Hive could take its place.

title: Cyberattacks are basically a way of life for most businesses now
description: Cyberattacks are the most prevalent disaster in the office, taking up almost half of all incidents that happen.

title: Black Friday TV deals live: $89 smart TVs, cheap OLEDs and more
description: We're live blogging the latest Black Friday TV deals and news today. Read on to see the biggest savings on 4K TVs, OLED sets and more.

description: A whole load of world records have fallen, including some big 3DMark scores.

title: The iPhone 15 might get a premium makeover
